generation

Class Distance

  • java.lang.Object
    • generation.Distance

  • public class Distance
extends java.lang.Object
    This class has the responsibility to provide the distance for each cell to the exit of a maze. It represents this information as a matrix, a 2D integer array. Its dimensions and positioning of (x,y) coordinates matches with the same notion in the Cells.java class that represents the walls for the maze. All methods assume that given (x,y) coordinates are with its legal range such that no additional parameter checks are performed. This is reasonable as this class is used only internally to the package. The expected lifecycle for an instance of this class is: a) initialization either by providing a distance matrix with valid distance values or by providing a cells object and calling for computeDistances to derive valid distance values, before b) obtaining information on distance values for specific positions as well as information about the exit or starting position for the maze. This code is refactored code from MazeBuilder.java by Paul Falstad, www.falstad.com, Copyright (C) 1998, all rights reserved Paul Falstad granted permission to modify and use code for teaching purposes. Refactored by Peter Kemper

    • Field Detail

      • width

        private int width
        The width of the distance matrix, same as width of maze and cells

      • height

        private int height
        The height of the distance matrix, same as height of maze and cells

      • dists

        private int[][] dists
        A matrix of dimension (width x height) with distance values to the exit of a maze. The use of indices between Distance and Cells internal 2D matrices is consistent such that (i,j) in dists refers to the same position in cells. Warning: class does not enforce encapsulation on dists. There are ways to set this reference, obtain it and manipulate its content.

      • exitPosition

        private int[] exitPosition
        The exit position has a distance of 1 which is also the minimum of all values in dists. Array of length 2, with coordinates (x,y) of exit position.

      • startPosition

        private int[] startPosition
        The start position has a maximum distance from the exit position, which is also the maximum of all vaues in dists. Array of length 2, with coordinates (x,y) of starting position. The field is initially null. Can be calculated only after distance values have been computed or distance matrix has been given to this instance.

      • INFINITY

        static final int INFINITY
        Define a readable constant to express that we have not found a finite distance value for some (x,y) position in matrix dists.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • Distance

        public Distance(int w,
                int h)
        Constructor
        Parameters:
        w - is the width of the maze in the horizontal direction
        h - is the height of the maze in the vertical direction

      • Distance

        public Distance(int[][] distances)
        Constructor that directly uses the given reference. Warning: the given parameter is shared, not copied. This breaks encapsulation and can have side effects. This constructor is currently only used in the MazeFileReader to hand a 2D array that is parsed from a file to a Distance object.
        Parameters:
        distances - is a non-null matrix of appropriate width x height dimension

    • Method Detail

      • setAllDistanceValues

        public void setAllDistanceValues(int[][] distances)
        Sets the internal attribute to the given parameter value. Can be used to provide precomputed distance values to an object or to use an existing array and have its values computed by a subsequent call to computeDistances(Floorplan) computeDistances. Warning, the array is not copied but directly shared with the environment that provides it! This can have undesired side effects. Handle with care!
        Parameters:
        array - with distance values, can not be null

      • getAllDistanceValues

        public int[][] getAllDistanceValues()
        Gets access to a width x height array of distances. Warning, this exposes the internal attribute and is intended for read access only. Do not modify entries of the returned array.
        Returns:
        array with distance values

      • getDistanceValue

        public int getDistanceValue(int x,
                            int y)
        Gets the distance value for the given (x,y) position
        Parameters:
        x - is the x coordinate, 0 <= x < width
        y - is the y coordinate, 0 <= y < height
        Returns:
        the distance value for the given (x,y) position

      • computeDistances

        public int[] computeDistances(Floorplan cells)
        Compute distances for given cells object of a maze. The method determines an exit position for the maze as well as a starting position. It computes a distance value for each position (x,y) that represents the number of steps through intermediate cells to reach the exit with the understanding that one can not cross walls and can only to go an adjacent position if there is no wallboard in between. The exit position is returned for convenience. This method provides the main responsibility of the class, namely to determine the distance to the exit position. Once called, client classes can use getDistanceValue, #getExitPosition(), getExitPosition, and getStartPosition.
        Parameters:
        cells - with information on wallboards for a maze, can not be null, read only
        Returns:
        exit position somewhere on the border

      • getStartPosition

        public int[] getStartPosition()
        Gets the starting position. Assumes that computeDistances() was called before.
        Returns:
        starting position somewhere within maze

      • getMaxDistance

        public int getMaxDistance()
        Gets maximum distance present in maze Assumes that computeDistances() was called before
        Returns:
        the maximum distance

      • getMinDistance

        public int getMinDistance()
        Gets minimum distance present in maze Assumes that computeDistances() was called before
        Returns:
        the minimum distance which should be 1 and is located at the exit position

      • getExitPosition

        public int[] getExitPosition()
        Gets the exit position. Assumes that computeDistances() was called before.
        Returns:
        exit position somewhere on the border

      • isExitPosition

        public boolean isExitPosition(int x,
                              int y)
        Determines if given position is the exit position.
        Parameters:
        x - is the x coordinate, 0 <= x < width
        y - is the y coordinate, 0 <= y < height
        Returns:
        true if (x,y) is the exit position, falls otherwise

      • getPositionWithMaxDistanceOnBorder

        private int[] getPositionWithMaxDistanceOnBorder()
        Finds the most remote point in the maze somewhere on the border. Requires that distances have been computed beforehand.
        Returns:
        array of length 2 encodes position (x,y)=(array[0],array[1])

      • getPositionWithMaxDistance

        private int[] getPositionWithMaxDistance()
        Get the position of the entry with the highest value.
        Returns:
        array of length 2 encodes position (x,y)=(array[0],array[1])

      • keepMaxDistance

        private int keepMaxDistance(int x,
                            int y,
                            int d,
                            int[] result)
        For a given candidate position (x,y), the method checks if it exceeds the given threshold for the distance value. If so it updates the result coordinates accordingly and returns the new threshold value.
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate
        y - the y coordinate
        d - the current maximum distance as a threshold for comparison
        result - the (x,y) coordinates of the position to memorize
        Returns:
        the new maximum distance after the comparison

      • getPositionWithMinDistance

        private int[] getPositionWithMinDistance()
        Get the position of the entry with the smallest value. If the values of the distance matrix are accurate, the result is the exit position.
        Returns:
        position with smallest distance

      • computeDists

        private void computeDists(Floorplan cells,
                          int ax,
                          int ay)
        Computes distances to the given position (ax,ay) for all cells in array dists.
        Parameters:
        cells - with information on wallboards for a maze, can not be null
        ax, - position, x coordinate
        ay, - position, y coordinate

      • pushDistanceValuesDFS2

        private void pushDistanceValuesDFS2(Floorplan cells,
                                    int sx,
                                    int sy)
        Follows a path as far as possible to push small distance values into the maze
        Parameters:
        cells - needed for checking wallboards, read only
        sx - starting position
        sy - starting position

      • countInfinity

        private int countInfinity()

      • updateNeighborDistancesAndDirection

        private CardinalDirection updateNeighborDistancesAndDirection(Floorplan cells,
                                                              int currentX,
                                                              int currentY)
        Updates distance values for adjacent cells that are reachable if value can be reduced to current distance plus 1.
        Parameters:
        cells - with information on wallboards for a maze, can not be null, read only
        currentX - x coordinate of current position
        currentY - y coordinate of current position
        Returns:
        direction for a neighbor that has been updated or null if there is none

      • saturateDistances

        Fix-point iteration on distance matrix.
        Parameters:
        cells - with information on wallboards for a maze, can not be null, read only
